Dear Harold:
Let me apologize for not sending this letter sooner, but
we have been completely swamped with several high priority type
projects. I intended to talk with Harry during his recent
visit to the Twin Cities, but so much was happening I didn’t
even get around to calling him on the phone.
I finally had a call from Seth Spalding of the U.S. Office
of Education. I think the call came because of Gertrude's per¬
sistency. He wanted to know what progress had been made on the
utilization kits and wanted a revised time table and budget for
the project. I sent this off to him and a carbon copy to Harry.
A blind copy for you is enclosed with this letter. Dr. Spalding
had several questions about our project. One of the first dealt
with the use of the Advisory Committee. He was extremely reluc¬
tant to go in on a budget that called for a full Committee
meeting in San Francisco. At Gertrude's suggestion we explained
that this was not just a committee meeting but a special group
to screen these proposals. This he tentatively bought and I
believe will go along with having a meeting of a selected group
in San Francisco on the 16th and 17th of October. This may
cause a small bit of dissension on the part of some of the
Utilization Committee members but if the U.S. Office is going
to limit us to a specific number of people, then we have to
make some kind of selection to be sure we get the people we
want.
RECEIVED
